title: Historically Black Colleges Targeted by Bomb Threats
sub_head: Classes were disrupted or canceled on more than a dozen campuses; no bombs found so far
body:
At least 16 historically Black colleges and universities in the U.S. said they received bomb threats Tuesday, disrupting classes or causing them to be canceled.
On Monday, at least five other HBCUs said they received threats. So far, no bombs have been found. There were 100 HBCUs in 2019, according to the National Center for Education Statistics.
